intro: Anthemis halacsyi, commonly known as the Hungarian chamomile, is a perennial herb native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its essential oils, derived from the flowers, are used in traditional medicine for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
